headline.print_headline: Keeping Children Safe, and Away, From Firearms

docs.abstract: The American Academy of Pediatrics warned that not only are killings and accidental shootings of children a concern in homes with guns, but so is suicide.
docs.snippet: The American Academy of Pediatrics warned that not only are killings and accidental shootings of children a concern in homes with guns, but so is suicide.

docs.lead_paragraph: The New York Academy of Medicine responds to an online Op-Ed essay, “At the E.R., Bearing Witness to Gun Violence.”
docs.snippet: The New York Academy of Medicine responds to an online Op-Ed essay, “At the E.R., Bearing Witness to Gun Violence.”

headline.main: What the Fight Over Guns Is Really About

docs.abstract: What is it about gun policy that makes it such an emotional topic?
docs.snippet: What is it about gun policy that makes it such an emotional topic?

docs.lead_paragraph: The popularity of the drinks reflects success in convincing consumers that they provide an edge, but most of their ingredients have no or little benefit, research shows.

headline.seo: Scant Proof Is Found to Back Up Claims by Energy Drinks
headline.main: Energy Drinks Promise Edge, but Experts Say Proof Is Scant
headline.print_headline: Energy Drinks Promise Edge, But Experts Say Proof Is Scant

docs.abstract: Energy drinks, fastest-growing part of beverage industry, claim to offer mental and physical edge, but review of scientific studies show that drinks are based on brew of ingredients that, apart from caffeine, have little benefit for consumers; rising popularity reflects industry's successful marketing campaign to convince Americans that drinks are specially engineered nutritional blends.
docs.snippet: The popularity of the drinks reflects success in convincing consumers that they provide an edge, but most of their ingredients have no or little benefit, research shows.

byline.contributor: Hiroko Tabuchi contributed reporting from Tokyo and Poypiti Amatatham from Bangkok.
